titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Alice Gore King (b. 1914) was a 1937 graduate of Bryn Mawr. She worked at the Brearley School in New York City in the Psychology Department (1937-1940 and 1945-1949), at Bryn Mawr as Warden (1940-1942) and at the Alumnae Advisory Center in New York City (1949-1979).

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of scrapbooks kept by Alice Gore King from the 1930s to the 1970s. The scrapbooks record the lives of Millicent Carey McIntosh, a Barnard dean, Katharine McBride, president of Bryn Mawr College, and many of the faculty and alumnae of Bryn Mawr. Scrapbooks contain clippings, photographs, and cards. The collection also includes bound copies of a newspaper King created as a child, a scrapbook of her wartime work at Pratt and Whitney Aircraft, scrapbooks of reviews and fan-mail for her books on careers for women, materials related to the founding and operation of the Alumnae Advisory Center, and photo albums from Bryn Mawr class reunions in the 1960s and 1970s.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Bryn Mawr College: Katharine McBride papers.
